This hardy and versatile shrub is an excellent choice for foundation plantings, hedges, or as a stand-alone specimen. It has a tendency to grow in a rounded shape and is often used in small gardens as a low hedge or foundation plant. The 'Dwarf Burford' cultivar of Chinese holly stays tidy and will reach a height of up to 6 ft and a width of 6 ft, perfect for residential garden settings. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in fall, followed by red berries. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4226,"attracts":["Birds"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"holly","description":"The Holly (Ilex 'Magland' OAKLAND) is a compact, dense evergreen shrub prized for its glossy, green and spiny-toothed foliage. Growing to around 4 feet (120cm) in height, its dark green leaves are also accented with bright yellow fruits. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4239,"attracts":["Birds"],"care_level":"Moderate","common_name":"American holly","description":"American holly (Ilex opaca 'Greenleaf') is an evergreen tree native to North America. It reaches up to 30 feet tall and 20 feet wide and is easily recognizable by its waxy, dark green leaves and red berries. The fruit is an important food source for birds and animals. Its stems are also quite long and covered with small, sharp thorns. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4275,"attracts":["Birds"," Hummingbirds"," Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"jewelweed","description":"Jewelweed (Impatiens capensis) is a member of the Balsam family, and is native to moist woodland regions in North America. It is a perennial wildflower with stems that reach 2-4 feet in height, boasting yellow and orange blooms with spotted interiors. Its leaves are long and pointed and have a mucilaginous sap texture which inspired its common name. This plant is renowned for its ability to treat poison ivy rash, and is often found in the wild in and near areas that harbor poison ivy. Its leaves are compound, alternate, and pinnately trifoliolate. The flowers of Chinese indigo are bright pink, and the fruit is a long pod with 12-20 seeds. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4300,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"moonflower","description":"Moonflower (Ipomoea alba) is an annual vining plant with fragrant white flowers that open at night and close by day. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4311,"attracts":["Hummingbirds"," Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"cypress vine","description":"Cypress vine (Ipomoea quamoclit) is a beautiful, fast-growin climber from the Convolvulaceae family with deeply-lobed, fern-like foliage and small, star-shaped flowers in a variety of colors such as pink, white, lavender, and red. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4373,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"standard dwarf bearded iris","description":"Iris ‘Kiwi Slices’ is a standard dwarf bearded iris with long, strap-like foliage and vibrant blooms. This perennial has large, ruffled flowers in yellow and blue shades, with yellow petals and brighter yellow crests on each petal. Blooming in late spring or early summer, it prefers full sun and slightly moist, well-drained soils. The plant has a basal clump of flat, sword-shaped leaves with prominent veins on both sides, and the leaves can grow up to about 20 cm in length. In spring, the blossom of Iris maackii is the main attraction with it's abundance of colour. They're incredibly pleasing to the eye and need minimal maintenance to stay in top condition.
